Patch Set 15:

(4 comments)
I don't think we need a `Summary:` header here.
Done
Is this the expected structure? Should we be using e.g. an IANA number here to differentiate OEMs? Maybe I should look at the IBM OEM stuff.

Other than the IANA related to firmware update, I don't see any consistent way of adding IANA to PLDM OEM commands.  The existing IBM OEM code doesn't do it.

Like I mentioned earlier, we're likely going to need to support OEM commands for vendors that we (the OpenBMC project) are not going to be able to dictate what their command set looks like.  What does it look like going forward to handle that use case?
This wasn't a blocking complaint, I was just thinking out loud and trying to educate myself.
Done
Slightly frustrating that DSP0242 is yet to be published. It would be nice to contrast what you have to what's specified there.
We can certainly transition to using DSP0242 once it becomes available if satisfies the needs (I don't have visibility to it).
Yeah I don't have any visibility either. Hopefully it's not too far away so we can avoid further OEM implementations of the concept.
Done

Hi Delphine, thanks for the patch. I have a few requests to get this in shape for merging. We might need to coordinate with IBM to get some logistical problems resolved with the implementation, as it must be possible to build and install the library with both `oem-ibm` and `oem-meta` enabled simultaneously.

A request not directly dealt with by the inline comments is that you also need to provide some test cases demonstrating expected behaviours for the positive and negative cases.
(marking this as unresolved as we need the test cases)

> it must be possible to build and install the library with both oem-ibm and oem-meta enabled simultaneously.

Why is this a problem?  The libpldm doesn't have the routing, right?  It is up to the pldmd to call the appropriate functions based on which device / OEM it is communicating with, right?

My reading is that PLDM doesn't explicitly have an IANA field, or similar, in OEM commands.  We have flexibility in the Meta ones where we could certainly define an OEM command that ends up with the {IANA + secondary command number} embedded as an early part of the payload but I don't think there is any way to do that natively in PLDM.

It is quite possible to need to enable multiple OEM command sets on a BMC.  Suppose, for example, that we have two different NIC vendors both using PLDM but with their own set of OEM commands.  We would need to support both of those OEM sets at once because either NIC could be attached to the BMC.

I think you're conflating two of my concerns here but in your defense I didn't properly state my motivation. The comment about enabling them both at once related to the header file collision and not the lack of an IANA separator for OEM commands (though I do think that is an oversight in the PLDM spec and I'm not what the behaviour is expected to be at runtime - your NIC example makes an excellent point).
Done
I think we're a bit inconsistent with its application, but can you please add a SPDX license marker and your copyright to the top of the file?
Done
Please use LIBPLDM_OEM_META_FILE_IO_H as the guard.
Do we need header guards or can we just use `#pragma once`?
I prefer we deviate the least we can achieve from the C standard. `#pragma once` isn't standardised so I'd prefer to avoid it.
Done
Isn't this specific to Meta? Should we include that in the names of the types and constants?
Done
As above?
Done

Please do not add further `__attribute__((packed))` structs. We've done a bunch of work to move away from that. You should be able to solve that by removing `__attribute__((packed))` here and using the `msgbuf` abstraction in the implementation of `decode_write_file_io_req()`
Done
Again, I think we probably want to include the name of the OEM in the symbol.
Done
Fix the comment as well after you rename the header guard.
Done
I think we're a bit inconsistent with its application, but can you please add a SPDX license marker and your copyright to the top of the file?
Done
It needs to be possible to build libpldm with both `oem-ibm` and `oem-meta` enabled simultaneously. That can't work well if both install the same header file.

Agreed.  We should probably install the header file in a way that doesn't lose the `oem/meta` portions.

Maybe the IBM ones aren't currently doing that?  We should probably transition them as such.

> Maybe the IBM ones aren't currently doing that?

They aren't

> We should probably transition them as such.

Yep, I would like Manoj or someone from IBM to follow up on that.
Done

The patch must first be merged with the function marked as `LIBPLDM_ABI_TESTING`. Only once it's merged - and once you've subsequently demonstrated its use in an application depending on the library - do we consider changing it to `LIBPLDM_ABI_STABLE` and capturing it in the ABI dump.

See the process described here:

https://github.com/openbmc/libpldm#development
Done

Firstly, C is less strict than C++ and doesn't require explicit casting to or from `void *` types.

However, that should not be necessary anyway as you should use the `msgbuf` abstraction to implement this function:

https://github.com/openbmc/libpldm/commit/c63f63a2d9d7d25b21b76a1a6098ee1a3176be7e
Done

My comment on PS2 wasn't specifically with respect to the response, it was covering the whole concept. I don't think it's appropriate to put `Follow DSP0242` here, especially when it is not yet published.
reverted
Hi Delphine, thanks for switching the implementation to use msgbuf. However, I do have a few further requests.
Can we please move this macro to the implementation until there's a strict need for it to be in a public header? Or if there already is a strict need, can we add a comment documenting the motivation?
Done
Let's try to be consistent and avoid `oem_meta` as a suffix. Instead I think this should be `decode_oem_meta_file_io_req()`, consistent with e.g. `struct pldm_oem_meta_file_io_type` above.
Done
Still missing the SPDX marker as requested on PS2
Added
This must test `data` also
Done
Nice! Thanks for using msgbuf.
Done
How do you feel about using the msgbuf insert APIs here to encode the message rather than open-coded endian handling and memcpy? I think that would make the test more maintainable.

Change to use pldm_msgbuf_insert.
But I'm unsure of the correct way to use pldm_msgbuf_insert when I want to skip the header size.
The function is now called `decode_oem_meta_file_io_req()`
Done
Can you please wrap this at 72 characters? This seems to be wrapped far to early.
Done
Why is "Example" indented here?
Done
Can you please switch the tabs to 4 spaces?
Done

Hi Delphine, thanks for the rework. I have some formatting comments on the commit message and some licensing issues that need to be addressed on the implementation. There's also a suggestion to help avoid breaking encapsulation in the test cases.
This should already be installed under e.g. `/usr/include/libpldm`, so there's no need for a second `libpldm` directory below `oem/meta`
It won't installed under /usr/include/libpldm after I remove out this one.

We need to fix the install directives then.  This file should be installed at: `/usr/include/libpldm/oem/meta/file_io.h`.  If it isn't installed in that location, something needs to be changed to make it so.

```
$ meson install -C build --destdir root
...
Installing /home/andrew/src/openbmc.org/openbmc/libpldm/include/libpldm/oem/meta/libpldm/file_io.h to /home/andrew/src/openbmc.org/openbmc/libpldm/build/root/usr/local/include/libpldm/
...
```

So the header is not installed in the expected location, under `${PREFIX}/${INCLUDE}/libpldm/oem/meta/`. Please update the patch with the expected location.
Done
Copyrights should include have a year.
Thanks for the info. Done

This is not how SPDX license markers work. Please look at the other files and https://spdx.dev/learn/handling-license-info/

Also, libpldm is licensed under Apache-2.0: https://github.com/openbmc/libpldm/blob/main/LICENSE
Thanks for the info ! done

Again, please look at other files for how they apply SPDX or see https://spdx.dev/learn/handling-license-info/

libpldm is licensed under Apache-2.0: https://github.com/openbmc/libpldm/blob/main/LICENSE
Done
Please fix the SPDX marker and the license.
Done

This could instead be dealt with when initialising the msgbuf:

```
pldm_msgbuf_init(ctx, 0 &buf[hdrSize], sizeof(buf) - hdrSize);
```
Thanks for the suggestion. done
Done
Hi Delphine, at a minimum the header installation path needs to be fixed. Patrick also has an opinion on the negative testing that I think is reasonable. Please address both in the next patchset.

This test is a little weak.  What does "bad" mean?  What about the request is "bad"?

The code has like 8 different error conditions but we're really only testing a single one.
Done
Isn't there still an extra 'libpldm' here?
Yes, please move the file up one level (and remove the leaf `libpldm` directory)
We revised it following latest main
please add doxygen
Done
we could remove this if moved under relevant `meson.build`
Done

This variable isn't obviously meta related and ... I don't really think we _should_ have one that is meta related.


Please see the 'preserve_path' option.  I'm pretty sure that is really what you're looking for.

https://mesonbuild.com/Reference-manual_functions.html#install_headers
+1 for `preserve_path` - that's also needed by the IBM OEM cleanup patch.
I think we can move these to relevant `meson.build` rather than root.
We revised it following latest main
We revised it following latest main
magic number?
Done
magic number?
Done

Hi Delphine, thanks for rebasing the patch on top of the rework from IBM. It makes the meson much cleaner. The main issue that needs to be addressed is the name of the struct (which becomes part of the API we have to control). The other comments are on implementation details.
The struct name needs to be `pldm_oem_meta_write_file_req` (i.e. include `_oem_meta`)
Done
Bit of a nit but should this be `Meta`? I don't think it's an acronym?
Done
Don't need to stash the return value here...
Done
... as this is redundant - it will be captured by `return pldm_msgbuf_destroy()` below.
Done
Please use `return pldm_msgbuf_destroy_consumed();` - this requires we've consumed exactly the size of the provided buffer and neither more (buffer overflow) nor less
I think at least this comment is still relevant, right?

If I change to use return pldm_msgbuf_destroy_consumed(); my test case testGoodDecodeRequest will fail because rc returns an invalid length. I'm not sure why its length is invalid, any suggestions how I can modify it?
Thanks for the info ! Modified code based on it.
What's going on that requires the use of `cfloat`?
Done
nit: since this is C++, can we use `static constexpr size_t` on these?
Done
Also this (static constexpr size_t).
Done
Looks like we have a merge conflict now.  Is this code close to being ready for review?  Seems like https://gerrit.openbmc.org/c/openbmc/pldm/+/67050 depends on it but this one is still marked WIP.
I suspect we need these prefixed in some way to include OEM_META also?  In C, enums pollute the global namespace.
Done
Do you actually want these to be in libpldm?  Seems like this is a command-handler artifact that you probably want to put in pldm only so that you don't need to make 2 commits for every new type?
Ack. move to pldm.
This might be a C-style vs C++-style, but are we ok moving `int rc` down to here since this is the only usage of it anyhow?
Ack
Hi Delphine. I think there are just a couple of things that remain to be addressed, and then it can be merged.
Done
Please drop this, it was recently removed from the other options.
Done
So close! There's just a small left-over in the command enum symbol names.

Ah, there's still the `_PLDM` in the middle which is a bit redundant now we have the `PLDM_` prefix 😞

Can you drop the one in the middle for both enum members?

Apologies that I'm being picky here, but it will become part of the public API for the library.
Done
Thanks!
Done
